definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: How can you possibly charge a 7-year-old child with assault and battery?
sentences.chinese: 怎么能将一个七岁的孩子判为袭击和殴打公职人员罪？

sentences.english: Hong Kong Commission Against Corruption is responsible for investigating corruption of bureaucrats.
sentences.chinese: 香港廉政公署负责调查公职人员的腐败问题。

sentences.english: Former Chinese supreme court vice president sacked for corruption.
sentences.chinese: 最高法原副院长黄松因腐败问题有被开除公职。

sentences.english: Head has the face of public officials?
But corrupt public officials used this as an advantage.
sentences.chinese: 但腐败的公职人员却以此来捞取好处。

sentences.english: Mr Cao, 41, has never held public office before.
sentences.chinese: 曹先生，41岁，以前没有担任过任何公职。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Hamlin could not be completely dislodged from public office.
sentences.chinese: 不过不能完全把哈姆林从公职甩掉。

sentences.english: Oath taking is the legal prerequisite and required procedure for public officers specified in the Article to assume office.
sentences.chinese: 宣誓是该条所列公职人员就职的法定条件和必经程序。

sentences.english: Among several entrepreneurs who have run for public office, one was elected to parliament.
sentences.chinese: 在几位竞选公职的企业家中，有一位当选为议员。

sentences.english: Randt did not have the long resume of public service that Huntsman has.
sentences.chinese: 相比亨茨曼，雷德并没有太长的公职履历。

sentences.english: Denial of a public-service job may blackball a person from future private employment as well.
sentences.chinese: 得不到公职的人也可能将来不为私人所雇用。

sentences.english: Candidates should apply for a government job at once.
sentences.chinese: 有意者，现在马上就应该去申请一份政府公职。

sentences.english: In the early republic, only property owners could vote or hold public office.
sentences.chinese: 共和国初年，只有财产所有人才可以投票或担任公职。

sentences.english: We will back him for public office.
sentences.chinese: 我们将支持他担任公职。

sentences.english: Fadhila Hanoosh Khalif is an unlikely candidate for public office.
sentences.chinese: Khalif是一个不太可能成功的公职参选人。

sentences.english: But she never had run for an elected position.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在这之前她从未竞选过公职。

definition: main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to hold an office or post
to look for a job/to seek employment
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
government (viewed as an organization)/institutions of government/government office
